LampShade needs permission to run in the background.

Once you have wirelessly connected to your lights, you can begin controlling them.

First, click on a light bulb or bulb group to select it.

Next, you are shown a page of moods you may play on your selected bulb(s). Moods can be simple color paterns or dynamic lighting animations.

Dynamic moods will continue playing until stopped. To view ongoing moods, look for the LampShade icon in your device's notification bar. To stop a mood, play a simple mood(such as ON or OFF) on the same bulb(s).

Moods contain lighting states such as colors and on/off commands.

While a mood is played on a group or bulb, these states take effect.

The states are set to take effect either immediately, over time relative to when the playing starts, or at specific times of the day while the mood is playing.

Channels (columns of states) allow you to play multiple colors at the same time. Each time a mood is played on a group, the group's lights will be assigned equally among the channels, round-robin style.

Alarms allow you to schedule moods to play at some time in the future.

Alarms can be set to repeat on specific days each week.

When using alarms with moods that change in brightness over time(such as Gentle Sunrise), the alarm brightness bar sets the maximum brightness for that mood.

Alarms are stored on your device, so they only take effect when your device can reach the lights over the network.

LampShade supports saving moods to electronic NFC tags.

Once a mood+group+brightness is saved on the tag, it will play anytime you touch the tag to your Android device (if the device is unlocked).

To use this feature, your device must support writing to NFC tags, and you need tags your device can write to.

The LampShade automation plugin supports many apps including Tasker, Locale, and Llama. These apps can use the plugin to play moods based on various conditions such as gps location, incoming notifications, and much more.

The plugin is accessed from within these apps, and provides a page for selecting which mood+group+brightness to trigger.

Q. Why aren't my Philips lights changing to bright green?
A. The Philips Hue regular and downlight models only contain Blue, Red and Yellow LEDs so they cannot display intense greens.

Q. Why aren't my Philips lights changing to dark reds or blues?
A. Your Philips lights might be running outdated software. Use the offcial Philips app to update the firmware on your hub and lightbulbs.

Q. Do LampShade alarms work when I'm away from home?
A. LampShade alarms can only take effect when LampShade is connected to your lights. They will only work when away from home if you are using the remote access feature.
